injection_risks.description: The code reads the /etc/resolv.conf file and parses its contents, but it does not perform any validation on the input. This could potentially lead to issues if the file is malformed or contains unexpected data.
The code uses the exec.Command function to execute the nslookup command, which could potentially lead to command injection vulnerabilities if user input is not properly sanitized.
The code uses the tls.Config struct with InsecureSkipVerify set to true, which could potentially lead to man-in-the-middle attacks if not properly validated.

Lack of validation on user input for server address and query types
